title: Influenza Immunisation Program for Monash University
cleaned_text: Influenza Immunisation Program for Monash University [Who can get yet?](#covid) [Further information](#info) [Some facts about the flu!](#facts) Flu season is just around the corner and we are doing our part to keep staff healthy and flu-free as the colder months approach. It is important we all try to maintain good health over the coming months. Who can get immunised at Monash University? - Eligible staff and eligible students, as determined by faculties and divisions. - Monash University Marketing and Communications will email eligible staff and eligible students about the program. - The email will provide information about how to register for the immunisation, including the booking link. - The Federal Government funds a specific influenza vaccination program for Australians 65 years of age and over. Our program can provide this government-funded vaccination for you. NOTE: If your faculty, division or entity is not participating, you will not be able to register for the immunisation at Monash University. If this applies to you, you can book an appointment with [University Health Services](https://www.monash.edu/students/support/health/medical/appointments), your GP or local participating pharmacy. Family members are NOT eligible to receive the vaccination as part of the Monash University vaccination program. How to book your appointment - All eligible staff and eligible students will receive an email from Strategic Marketing and Communications (UMAC) with instructions and a link to the Health Watch Australia online booking system. You can also access the booking system [HERE](https://monashuni2023flu.bookings.health/booking.d.php). - Only eligible participants will be able to book. - You MUST book online to ensure your registration is recorded and to secure a time and venue that is convenient to you. Over 65s The Federal Government is again funding a specific Influenza Vaccination Program for Australians aged 65 years and over. The Monash program can provide this government-funded vaccination. As per Australian Immunisation Register requirements, Monash staff aged 65 years and over who require the age-specific immunisation must register via the online booking link and present their Medicare card at their appointment. Staff can access the over-65 vaccine through this program. Please note this may be subject to government availability of the vaccine at the time of your appointment. As you will have provided your date of birth on the registration form, your age will be visible to the nurse at the time of your appointment. They will ask you and provide you with the appropriate vaccine at the time of your appointment. On the day DO NOT attend a flu vaccination appointment if you are unwell. - We strongly recommend wearing a mask while you receive your flu vaccination, as you will be within 1.5 metres of the person providing you with the vaccination. - You must bring your Monash ID card or M-Pass to be scanned to record your attendance at the time of your vaccination. - To cancel your appointment and rebook, refer to your booking confirmation email from Health Watch Australia (HWA). COVID Safe measures: - The flu vaccination program will be conducted in accordance with our [COVID Safe Plan](https://www.monash.edu/__data/assets/pdf_file/0010/2406790/COVID-Safe-Plan.pdf). - Our vaccination sites have been assessed to provide adequate space for privacy, physical distancing and other infection control measures. - Vaccinators will wear masks and sanitise their hands throughout vaccination sessions. Record of vaccination Your flu vaccination will be recorded on the [Australian Immunisation Register (AIR)](https://www.servicesaustralia.gov.au/individuals/services/medicare/australian-immunisation-register). You can access your immunisation record via your Medicare online account through [myGov](https://my.gov.au/LoginServices/main/login?execution=e4s1) within 24-48 hours after your vaccination. For this reason, you will be asked to provide your Medicare card details at the time of booking. If you are not eligible for Medicare, you will still get your flu vaccination free of charge and you can access your vaccination record through [My Health Record](https://www.myhealthrecord.gov.au/for-you-your-family/howtos/register-for-my-health-record). Further information can be found [here](https://www.servicesaustralia.gov.au/individuals/services/medicare/australian-immunisation-register/how-get-immunisation-history-statement). What if I haven't had my COVID-19 booster yet? We strongly encourage all members of the Monash community to get their booster as soon as they're eligible and able (six months after your last dose or COVID infection). There is currently no combined influenza and COVID-19 vaccine, so if you require both vaccines, you will need to make separate bookings. [Book your COVID-19 booster dose vaccination appointment.](https://www.coronavirus.vic.gov.au/get-vaccinated) Further information If you have questions, email OH&S at [BPD-OHS-FluVacs@monash.edu](mailto:BPD-OHS-FluVacs@monash.edu) or call the Buildings and Property Helpdesk on 990 20222. - More information on the influenza is available at [Better Health](https://www.betterhealth.vic.gov.au/health/healthyliving/flu-influenza-immunisation). - Learn more on the [Influenza (flu) vaccine](https://www.health.gov.au/topics/immunisation/vaccines/influenza-flu-vaccine?language=en)on the Department of Health and Aged Care website. - Health Watch Australia - [2023 Flu Vaccination Program](https://www.monash.edu/__data/assets/pdf_file/0011/3249812/Health-Watch-Australia-2023-Flu-Vaccination-Program-FAQs.pdf). Some facts about the flu! - Between 5% and 20% of the Australian population may be infected with influenza each year. - Vaccination is the single most effective way of protecting yourself against influenza infection. [Hand washing](https://www2.health.vic.gov.au/Api/downloadmedia/%7B315232D5-002E-400F-BEF3-AC457586851A%7D), covering your [cough or sneeze](https://www2.health.vic.gov.au/Api/downloadmedia/%7B2D6408F0-991C-430E-8FB0-9AB4DBB6B891%7D), practicing good personal hygiene such as trying not to touch your mouth or nose, are also important preventative measures. - Follow these [healthy habits](https://www.monash.edu/__data/assets/pdf_file/0018/1703241/Health-Habits-to-avoid-Flu.pdf)to avoid influenza and view these
